channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street light not been working for over 4 weeks now, 8th January
item.description:
The lamp post was damaged and the top was hanging off they came and removed this and installed a new lamp post but have not fitted a light so there is still no light making the road very dark and dangerous when walking alone.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Silver Spring Close, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain in pavement blocked all the way down in front of shops, 8th January
item.description:
The problem has been getting worse for 3 months

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Forest Road, Slade Green, Greater London

item.title: Drain on gillett square is not working, 8th January
item.description:
Water isn’t draining away - it’s gathering around the vortex jazz club, causing slips and potential conditions for a serious fall. It’s impossible to see so lots of people wading through above ankle height

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gillett Square, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped broken cabinet, 8th January
item.description:
Two women carried a broken cabinet out of 1, Oakmere Road, SE2 and dumped it round the corner on Wickham Lane SE2 outside the empty shops.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wickham Lane, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights not working, 8th January
item.description:
I reported this nearly 2 months ago and it has been marked fixed. It has not been fixed, on this road is a cadet detachment and a nursery and the road leads to some woods.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fox House Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: Graffiti off an offensive nature towards Sir Keir STARMER, 8th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Horn Lane, East Greenwich, Greater London

item.title: Large number of household items and furniture, 8th January
item.description:

item.title: Flytipping Chesterfield Grove (along the wall of Joe the Juice shop) 5th Complaint, 8th January
item.description:
5th complaint submitted: Increase of flytipped items that has still not been cleared. Extra black bags of rubbish which now has a severe stench and now 2 chairs dumped. It is a health and safety danger in encouraging vermin for residents including children, the elderly and the wider community. This is simply not acceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Chesterfield Grove, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Damaged pavement

item.title: The dog waste bin on the green area by Southdown House is overflowing, 8th January
item.description:
Health hazard and eyesore - the dog poo bin on the green area - near the playground and Southdown House - hasn’t been emptied in weeks. Waste is overflowing and being dumped on top. Sort it out Southwark Council.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pytchley Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Still completely flooded after rain, despite previous remedial work, 8th January
item.description:
Two previous reports raised but still completely flooded after rain, required pedestrians to walk on extremely slippery grass verge

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackbrook Lane, Bickley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooded Blocked Drains, 8th January
item.description:
This drain is constantly blocked and when it rains it floods heavily. Immersing the parked car wheels and tyres unwater for hours (which can have huge safety implications and damage the wheels). This drain has been reported many times but has never been resolved. The fraunnis litaged directly outside house 104 Thorpedale Road N4.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 100, Thorpedale Road, Finsbury Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned van, 8th January
item.description:
This van has been parked on this road since 30th December 2025… there are load of goods in the back of it that don’t look legitimate/stolen. The local foxes are now in the van (as it’s open in the back for good to be transported) digging in the boxes and packages sitting in it, probably looking for things for their home. There are what looks like brand new duvets and pillows and other boxes. This road has recently been made permit holders only but no one has moved this van or come to check on it….

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Sturdy Road, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped large food caddy with stuff inside it (not food), 8th January
item.description:
Needs to be removed. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kenilworth Road, Penge, Greater London
